message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.CR. 

The paper proposes a regularization method for graph convolutional networks (GCNs) to improve their performance in semi-supervised node classification tasks. This falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The method involves generating virtual adversarial perturbations for nodes in a graph, which can be seen as a form of data augmentation or perturbation-based regularization. This connects to computer vision (cs.CV) and natural language processing (cs.CL) sub-categories, where similar techniques have been used for image and text data. Finally, the paper also discusses the security implications of adversarial attacks on GCNs, which relates to the sub-category of cryptography and security (cs.CR).
